intro: Harpullia angustialata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf harpullia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically split open to release seeds. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
